caseProcess.description: The case was filed by the Oakwood, Arlington, Procuratorate based on evidence of tax evasion discovered during a standard audit of Z. Ruiz's business finances.
Oakwood, Arlington, Procuratorate applied for detention measures against Z. Ruiz, citing potential risk of evidence tampering.
Oakwood police detained Z. Ruiz under suspicion of evading tax arrears recovery.
Official arrest of Z. Ruiz was confirmed based on gathered evidence and witness testimonies.

criminalFacts.crimeName: Crime of Evading Tax Arrears Recovery

details.behavior: Z. Ruiz transferred $50,000 to an offshore account in the Cayman Islands to prevent recovery of owed taxes.
details.evidence: Bank statements showing the transfer on 15th, March, 2021, and an email exchange discussing concealment strategy dated 10th, March, 2021.

details.behavior: Hid valuable business equipment worth $30,000 in a storage unit registered under a third-party name.
details.evidence: Photographs of the equipment in the storage unit taken by a private investigator on 20th, September, 2021; rental agreement signed by the third party.

details.behavior: Created fake invoices totaling $20,000 to show payments for non-existent services in an attempt to decrease taxable income.
details.evidence: Copies of fake invoices dated between 10th, November, 2021, and 30th, November, 2021; testimony from the supposed service provider confirming no services were rendered.

judgmentResult.crimeName: Crime of Evading Tax Arrears Recovery
judgmentResult.sentence: 5 years of fixed-term imprisonment, fined $100,000 which is four times the evaded tax amount.
judgmentResult.sentencingConsiderations: Due to the significant amount of tax evasion over a protracted period involving considerable planning and deceit.
